user_query: How can households reduce peak energy consumption during the evening hours
groundtruth_answers: Households can reduce peak energy consumption by shifting flexible activities such as dishwashing and laundry to later hours when demand is lower
Using programmable thermostats to precool or preheat the home before the evening peak can lower the load during high demand periods
Adopting energy efficient appliances that require less power during operation helps reduce the household peak profile
Installing smart plugs or home energy management apps allows residents to control and schedule devices to avoid operating them at peak times
Participating in utility demand response programs can help households receive incentives for reducing consumption during peak windows
Improving insulation and air sealing can decrease heating and cooling needs which are usually the largest contributors to peak household demand
